title: How to create 2 acounts in Thunderbird with same full name
content: I have been using Thunderbird (now 102.15.0, 64 bit) on Ubuntu Linux for several years now. I have 2 gmx accounts with the same full name (not aliases) introduced when they were created. The parameters (email address, pswd) for these accounts are different, of course. When I want to create IMAP (or POP3) accounts in Thunderbird for the 2nd gmx address, this fails. and I get the message : « unable to login at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password ». This forces me to manage my emails as webmail only, which defeats the main purpose of using Thunderbird, of course (i.e. to manage all emails/accounts on the same page). How can I go around this issue? Do I have to change my full name on the gmx server?
creator: prfndr

title: Customisation of the card view
content:

Of course there is a menu and a context menu but all this requires more moves. Can I customise what I can see and interact with on a card?

title: Upgrade to Thunderbird v115 has lost me access to emails/folders/contacts
content:
After the automatic upgrade to 115.2.2, I have lost access to all my folders, emails and calendar entries. But I can still see my addresses by using Tools/Address Book, and my filters by using Tools/Message Filters.

When I started Thunderbird for the first time on 115.2.2 I got to the usual message page which had all the tabs of the "open" emails I had when I last closed Thunderbird. But there was no sign of my folders and I couldn't get to any other messages (See first screenshot). I also had a second occurrence of Thunderbird running (I could have hit the icon a second time) that didn't show the tabs I had on the first screen. (No screen shot)

On a previous post here https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1424153 it was suggested that I try Troubleshoot mode. That made no difference and at that time I had no folders showing, and just two tabs. I suspect after that I deleted the tabs.

Now I get a completely blank page in what is usually the message/folder area. Also the button for the address book above the message pane has now gone disappeared (Second screen shot), and I can find no way of accessing my previous (10years+ of messages).

It looks to me as if something is wrong in the profile.

Where do I go from here?
creator: mara1618

title: High power usage and problems receiving emails and opening PDFs

None of these problems has happened before. I'm running Windows 10 on a PC.

title: Emails
content:
- Open TB - Open Inbox to see all emails - Open an email, read it, delete it - Scroll down, reading email Subjects until I find another email I want to open (this may be 30-40 lines or more) - Open another email, read it, delete it

The cursor/highlight then jumps back up to the previously highlighted email (next to the first email I deleted). Now I don't know where I am, I don't know what email Subjects I have already looked at, I don't know where the next unlooked-at email is. In order to get back to where I was before I deleted the second email, I have to scroll down through many emails I have already scrolled through.

How do I stop TB from doing this? I want the cursor/highlight to stay right where it was before I delete any email, I do not want it jumping to some previous location.

title: Thunderbird 115, local "mother" folders that receive new messages (via message filters) do not appear in blue anymore
content:
In the previous version I was using, when a new email arrives and is automatically moved to a custom local folder, that custom local folder name was appearing in bold letters and BLUE color.

The folder I am referring to is the "mother" folder and inside that "mother" folder there are sub-folders. The "mother" folder was coloring in blue when a new email arrived.

Now with version 115 this feature is lost, the custom folder name that receives a new email now appears in bold letters BUT BLACK colour.

I have something like 1234 custom local folders, some folders contain emails that I have read but I am keeping that email as unread because it requires an action (like a "to do" email). These folder in the previous version of thunderbird were appearing in black color while new emails (that I actually never read) that were sent to a custom folder, that custom folder was apperaing in blue.

This color differentiation was helping me by immediately recognizing folder that contains new emails from foldars that contains not-new-but-unread emails

How can I do to make a custom folder appearing of bold letters and blue color when it receive a new email?

creator: bearmouth

title: Sending - Unable to authenticate Outgoing server (SMTP)
content:
I'm on Thunderbird version 115.2.2 (64bit) under Windows 10 on an Acer laptop. My mail provider and ISP is British Telecom (BT). I use SMTP not IMAP. A couple of days ago TB suddenly stopped sending emails (and I mean suddenly - one minute ok, next minute not) with a message saying it could not connect with the SMTP server and requested a 'new' password. Giving one (i.e. the correct one, again) produced even more errors along the same vein. Neither stopping and starting TB nor a computer restart made any difference. I seem to remember it wasn't receiving then either but on some support site somewhere it suggested I ensured my Windows was up to date. I did that and emails are now received (but still won't send).

I've been searching the internet for ideas but nothing has suggested anything other than check the password, the SMTP server name, the connection security, the authentication method and the port. See the attached screenshot. None of these things has changed for ages, yet it started to misbehave very suddenly. I did actually change the password on my account and tried that - made no difference. I have stopped my ZoneAlarm firewall temporarily, tried a send which failed again and restarted it, so it's not the firewall (Windows FW is off). I have another BT email account in TB and they both do the same thing. I have three other accounts in TB and they all work properly as they go through two other providers' SMTP servers. I set up a new BT account and made it an IMAP one in TB. Same result. Deleted it. The odd thing is that if I access my mail through the web browser that BT provide, emails can be sent and received no problem. It's for that reason that the BT support desk will not look into this problem. I've called them twice now. The first agent suggested I contacted Microsoft, for some reason, which I tried to do but their support website says they do not do telephone support any more and all the suggested Help topics vaguely related to this problem are concerned with MS products like Outlook and Hotmail. The second washed his hands of the problem as soon as he heard that webmail works and strongly suggested I try Thunderbird support, so here I am. It does seem logical I suppose.

Sorry to be so verbose but I wanted to get everything out. Any advice would be useful but I hope someone has the magic bullet. I'm really starting to get fed up with this.

Bill
creator: billhamilton.1

title: Thunderbird Portable 115.2.2 "Sort by" problem
content:
Thunderbird 115.2.2 Portable, I have just installed it on a new device and the problem I am having is that the Sort by- Unthreaded- Descending works fine, but the Sort by->Grouped by Sort-> Descending, sorts the group headings correctly, but the idividual mails in each group are sorted in Ascending order. The images below show the result. All that I did between them was change the Sortby from Unthreaded to Grouped By Sort. The strange thing is that I had previously updated my existing TB Portable on a different drive, and it continues to work fine, maintaining the descending order within the groups. So is there another pref setting which controls the in group sort order or is it a bug in the software?

They also seem to have re-introduced an earlier problem whereby the previous state of the Grouped by Sort view ie, groups expanded or groups collapsed or the partial state of both, is not remembered. That is the case for the newly installed version and the older updated version. Everything worked fine with this up to version 102.14.0 until I updated on the 15th of this month.

title: Update changed IMAP to POP, using Earthlink
content:
After the update to Thunderbird 115.2.3, Thunderbird downloaded and deleted messages I had left on the server. I use Earthlink as my email server. I should have realized what happened when I suddenly had over 2500 sets of duplicate emails.

It appears that my Thunderbird is now set up for POP, although it had been IMAP for years. This is the second (or third) time his has happened in the last 6 months.

Three questions: 1) Can I change back to IMAP from POP without losing more 2) Is there a way to restore any of these emails to the server? 3) How can I prevent this in the future; once I update and restart, it is too late to prevent something like this as the damage is done.

Thank you.
